name: NBCNews
text:
Public health workers are receiving violent threats as they try to fight COVID-19.

“We’re facing these really difficult ethical dilemmas: Do I stay in my job and risk threats, or do I leave because it’s not worth it?” https://t.co/FrqkBLZPAp

name: NBCNews
text:
Statues, monuments, murals and flags are coming down across the country. 

See where they're being taken down across the U.S. https://t.co/ejLldzTRih

name: NBCNews
text: Dave Chappelle talks about George Floyd’s death in a new Netflix special: “When I watched that tape, I understand this man knew he was gonna die." https://t.co/FeWkKZloQP

name: NBCNews
text: NFL free agent Antonio Brown will serve 2 years of probation, undergo a psychological evaluation, attend an anger management course and perform community service for charges related to a fight with a moving trucker driver. https://t.co/TvMi4XDSR2

name: NBCNews
text: US Customs and Border Protection spent portions of a $112M emergency fund meant to buy food, medicine, and other items for migrants on ATVS, dirt bikes, and boats, according to a Government Accountability Office report. https://t.co/yWSBJiFaKq

name: NBCNews
text: The Republican majority in the statehouse rejected an amendment that would “prohibit the sale, display, possession or distribution of Confederate memorabilia at local and county fairs.” https://t.co/4obyblycUb

name: NBCNews
text: Sec. Pompeo is denying allegations that the State Dept.'s inspector general was fired for investigating his possible misuse of government resources. https://t.co/lSF0GSr3dA

name: NBCNews
text: Sony has unveiled the PlayStation 5 game console design. https://t.co/tMa7riMUgH

name: NBCNews
text: A Kentucky teen who killed 2 classmates and injured others when he opened fire at his high school in 2018 has been sentenced to 2 life sentences. https://t.co/lsILz2EvWf

name: NBCNews
text: Minnesota's pardons board voted 3-0 to pardon Max Mason, one of several traveling circus workers accused in the 1920 case. Gov. Walz, a member of the board, called it “100 years overdue.” https://t.co/hpig0HX5yJ

name: NBCNews
text: With more rigorous testing of plasma treatment underway, a nationwide study is hoping to answer the next logical question: Could giving survivors plasma right after a high-risk exposure to the virus stave off illness? https://t.co/wBRUKv9J5a

name: NBCNews
text: NEW: President Trump delays Tulsa rally that had been planned for Juneteenth amid backlash. https://t.co/CgcTkvEGil

name: NBCNews
text: How Bruce Lee became a symbol of solidarity with the Black community. https://t.co/LpHo5V8UQB - @NBCAsianAmerica

name: NBCNews
text: The Uganda Wildlife Authority has arrested 4 people over the death of Rafiki, a gorilla who was hugely popular with tourists, in Bwindi Impenetrable National Park. https://t.co/L4uPmS5nyO

name: NBCNews
text: States that had committed to using contact tracing apps or expressed interest are now backing away from those claims. https://t.co/J64Niu3Uo1

name: NBCNews
text: An 18-year-old man has drowned after getting caught in a current and going over a waterfall at a national preserve in Alabama, authorities say. https://t.co/LEMTVmsz1t

name: NBCNews
text: An emergency medical technician in New Jersey was removed from a volunteer board of health after he made racist and threatening Facebook comments about participants of a Black Lives Matter protest. https://t.co/xVqMDrXCga
